intro: Pedicularis comosa subsp. nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. This subspecies is often found in meadows and open slopes, where it plays a role in local pollinator ecosystems.
